intro: Herniaria kotovii, commonly known as the stonecress, is a small flowering plant native to the cold, rocky regions of the Arctic and alpine areas. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are typically fleshy and succulent, adapted to retain moisture in harsh environments. Herniaria kotovii is often found on rocky slopes and in sandy soils, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
